Reviews.Title: “A/C didn't work very well”
Reviews.Author: Kirk H
Reviews.Content: The room was clean and the staff was nice. It was early evening when we checked in. We dropped off our stuff, turned the A/C down to 65 degrees, and headed downtown for a few hours. When we came back, the room wasn't cool at all. It was probably between 75 and 80 and that's about what the temperature was outside. I didn't feel like jacking with changing rooms or having someone come up and work on the A/C at 1:00 AM, so we just went to sleep. I have to admit, the bed was very comfortable. I was a bit disappointed about the A/C though. For $99.87/ night I expect the A/C to work right.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, good location, pleasant staff”
Reviews.Author: benandki
Reviews.Content: We stayed in one of the larger suites just behind the lobby (we were upgraded by the incredibly helpful and cheerful guy at reception, who also gave us some good advice and recommendations throughout our stay). The room itself was very clean, very large, with a massive king size bed. Large flat screen TV, microwave, etc. Looks slightly dated, lots of artex swirls, but certainly not unpleasant. Room could be a little noisy from heavy doors, and people using their bathrooms, but our sleeping patterns were a little messed up, so not sure if it would normally wake you up! Simple serve yourself breakfast - hot waffles, cereal, juices, pastries, some fruit and yoghurt. Not spectacular, but good enough. Not warm enough to use the pool, but it looked quite nice and clean. Location is great, very easy to get in to central Dallas, we found cheap parking on N Lamar and Ross - $7 all day at the America Parking lot. Also very easy to get on the main highways. Denny's across the road serves simple but tasty food, 24 hours a day, very cheap.

Reviews.Title: “Great Overall for Price”
Reviews.Author: Neal P
Reviews.Content: I am a business traveler and finding a place to stay that makes you feel at home is important to me. This a great neighborhood, lots of resturants with shopping close by if you need anything. The rooms are very clean and you will get a great night sleep (no noisey traffic). What I appreciate the most is how the staff works together in providing a pleasant travel experience. I truely felt at home. Thanks again everyone. You are the reason I look forward to many happy returns. You truely do offer the best service.

Reviews.Title: “Going to DMC? This choice isImproving but still needs a bit more”
Reviews.Author: dachmation
Reviews.Content: This is the most economic option but it is an older hotel that is being improved slowly. The complimentary breakfast is as good as any you will get. The daytime staff is excellent. It was quiet, i felt safe and felt my car was safe. The drive to DMC is short-- You can follow I35 access road to Oaklawn and turn east and there are many nice restaurants. The quality of bedding improved and the TV's have been upgraded since my last visit. The constant roar of the fan when you turn on the bathroom light remains- The price found on Expedia including an AAA discount was $10. more than last time.

Reviews.Title: “WARNING!!! for active military”
Reviews.Author: jason v
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in a nice part of Dallas Tx off the expressway. We checked in and were told we would receive the standard military discount. The rate was supposed to be between 85 and 89 plus tax... That is standard fare for weekend government rates. The charges received were in excess of 310.00 total for two rooms. On the subject of rooms, the shower leaked all over the floor, room was dirty and staff were obvioulsy ready to take advantage of travelers. I have stayed in hotels all over the world. One that comes to mind is the Movenpick hotel in Dubai... Our rate there is 156.00 a night for a five star Swedish hotel that is immaculate and with ammenities that far outweigh this dump... I have tried several times to contact the front desk on this matter however, no one will pick up the phone... When I contacted the Best Western customer service, I was informed that this chain can add charges post to original agreement. That is the way Best Western says GFY... If you are active military, DoD or DoS, do not stay at this hotel. I believe it was foriegn owed due to its lack of upkeep and poor staff. As a side note, anytime you decide to stay at a hotel that clames three diamonds but is listed as two stars, beware. Also, if they have security in the parking lot for the cars -even if it is in a spectacular area of town, take note... Update, I actually made contact with the front desk in regards to this matter and they said, "we dont care, you can do what you want" in response to this statement above... This I suppose is the only recourse that you can have these days when you get ripped off from big buisness...

Reviews.Title: “Awful”
Reviews.Author: walkinandrollin
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel in advance as my husband is wheelchair bound and we have to a handicapped room. When we tried to check in, we were told the handicapped rooms were all full. We were offered a room on the first floor, but it was not in anyway accessible for a person in a chair. That was the extent of the management trying to correct their error. Luckily for us, we had tried to check in early in the evening, so we had time to drive around and try to find another hotel whose handicapped rooms were not booked. Very, very disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “I loved it”
Reviews.Author: haras_11
Reviews.Content: This hotel has been revamped and done up and is definately worth staying in since some of the previous reviews. I loved my room! Id been staying in hostels up to this point during my travels around USA so maybe my standards had been lowered but this place felt like a palace. We had a room with 2 queen beds that were HUGE, they were immaculately made up and SO comfortable. The whole room was clean, the bathroom was great and we had a little balcony too. The man working on reception (grey hair and moustache) was LOVELY he was so nice and helpful he really made our stay. The pool area was great with a hot tub, sun loungers, tables and umbrellas. Each floor has an ice machine, and theres wifi aswell as a computer room with printer/fax which is free to use. We found it a little hard to get to as we dont drive, but we managed in the end. There is a bus stop down the street, im not sure how reliable the busses are but we managed to get one downtown and it only took a matter of minutes to get there. I only saw 1 cockroach and that was outside by the benches near the pool, it was 40 degrees celcius so what do you expect! Our room was in the main building and from the sounds of it the rooms there are nicer than the ones surrounding the pool. I'd definately stay here again, there is a Dennys opposite for food 24/7, another resturant further down the street and a 7/11 style shop. Further down towards downtown (a 15/20 min walk) you'll find McDonalds etc.

Reviews.Title: “This place was great.”
Reviews.Author: andreweggins
Reviews.Content: Location â€“ If you have a car, itâ€™s great... If you donâ€™t it can be a bit of a hassle. There is a bus stop very close to the hotel, but the public transport isnâ€™t that reliable. Staff â€“ Were great, very friendly and helpful. The Room â€“ Our room went above and beyond our expectations. The room was extremely large with a small balcony, it was very clean and well maintained. Clearly it wasnâ€™t 5 star standard, but for our needs it was perfect. Our room had a fridge and a microwave, a king bed and a sofa bed, flat screen tv. We would definitely stay here again. The Breakfast was the only disappointing part of our stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Improved”
Reviews.Author: dachmation
Reviews.Content: It's still basic but the owners are trying to improve it a bit-- better sheets, better breakfast- but the a/c sounds like a semi-- but if you're going for the dallas market-- this is a safe, clean place to stay

Reviews.Title: “horrible,one of the worst”
Reviews.Author: nabilafarhat
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very bad, and the room i was assigned was in front of the swimming pool,where everything you hear.the room in appalling conditions and of the course breakfast buffet,bad without variety.when locate hotels,we must look at the areas of the lobby and the dining room.There are other hotels near this much better.but this is not losrecomiendo expensive and it is bad.they try to remodel but is not enough.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, nice room, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: nickster99
Reviews.Content: *This review left by a 35 year old Australian male* This was a great hotel and I paid around $60 per night. The room is big and there is free wi-fi. Big comfortable bed. There is a coin laundry on the premises too which is handy. Across the road is a 24 hour Denny's. The breakfast at this hotel was a big let down though I only went once (went to Denny's the other mornings). The fitness room is basic (just 2 running machines I think). You probably want to have rental/hire car if you stay here (I did). I don't know if there's any public transport close by. Overall I recommend this hotel. Ask if you can get a room in the main building rather than the annex part at the back.

Reviews.Title: “Acceptable for what we needed”
Reviews.Author: msangiebabie
Reviews.Content: Compared to other hotels in the area this one looked a little old and worn. There was some construction going on so I guess updates are on the way. The rooms were kind of small, but we were not planning to spend a great deal of time at our hotel so it was ok. One issue we had was with the air conditioning. Ours was not working very well and the temp outside was over 100 degrees. The front desk clerk was not real helpful, but after some phone calls the manager showed up and moved us to a different room which was nice and cool. The pool was nice. If you're looking for nice amenities and luxury this is not the place, but if you just need a place to rest at night it will do.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful choice”
Reviews.Author: Janet79720
Reviews.Content: I picked this one due to it being close to Irving (went to the Genghis Khan exhibit there) and then about a mile from the West End District. I read several negative and positive reviews, but decided to go with this and am glad I did. The front desk clerk (can't remember his name) was very friendly and helpful with restaurant recommendations. The hotel has 3 floors, but has elevators. The decorations and furnishings looked relatively new. The continental breakfast had a variety of selections. Will stay there again if we are ever in that area in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Accommodating Staff”
Reviews.Author: Giaconda
Reviews.Content: As Captain of a team playing in the US volleyball nationals, I reserved all the rooms for my team. The staff was very accommodating with this request and my team was pleased with the rooms we had (all on the same floor as requested). The hotel was an easy drive to the Dallas Convention Center where the vb venue was held--city roads with not much traffic. The staff was very helpful as to questions regarding restaurants and other venues in the area. The rooms were a little small, but very clean. Would have liked a microwave in the room, but used the one in the breakfast area. L. Bushey

Reviews.Title: “It was a great experience”
Reviews.Author: Roy6565
Reviews.Content: Service was great. The room was in very good shape. Swimming pool was especially nice. The best part of the stay was the complementary breakfast. they had a lot of items overall it was a very good experience. I would definitely recommend it

Reviews.Title: “Humble hotel with a great heart”
Reviews.Author: jjokwalinga
Reviews.Content: I visited the Dallas Texas, from 5th to 9th April, 2011 and against good judgment booked into Best Western Market Center, considering many negative guest reviews. I was not disappointed. For a low budget, the rooms were very spacious and clean. Renovations are in their final stages. The staff are very helpful and are willing to give that broad welcoming smile. Even for one visiting for the first time, I did not feel like the outsider. Best Western is surely my preferred choice the next time I am in Dallas Texas. To you all, thanks for making my stay memorable..

Reviews.Title: “Not even as a last resort”
Reviews.Author: roaming-wifi
Reviews.Content: Wow this place really is a dump. The ONLY good thing about it is the Dennyâ€™s across the road!! The man at the front desk told me that I didnâ€™t have a reservation even after I produced my receipt and confirmation details printed directly from the Best Western website. He actually said that you should never book from their website as itâ€™s unreliable. Then he said that due to a Windpower convention happening over the week they were fully booked. He shuffled papers around for ten minutes, hoping I would just go away and then reluctantly produced a key. Our room was really gross, and my standards are usually low. The room smelled of damp, like sweaty soggy socks. We realised it was the carpet, it was wet all the way through. We had to keep the door open most of the time. I rang around a few other hotels to see if there was a room anywhere in town, there couldnâ€™t have been anything worse than this place, but we were trapped there. The furniture in the room was really shabby and there were hairs in all the drains. This place needs to be hosed down with disinfectant, then knocked down, rebuilt and then disinfected again. We spent more time in town and in Dennyâ€™s than in our room, just because we hated it. Keep away from this place unless you enjoy staying in filthy conditions and keeping your possessions up off the floor.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap but limit your expectations”
Reviews.Author: dachmation
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this motel on and off for several years because it is close to the Dallas Market Center-(plus Denny's across the street is very quick and friendly)- we stopped staying when the prices rose but the standards fell-bruised banana's at breakfast--empty soap dispensers, crappy TV) now the prices have dropped--we found $64 a night on Best Western site with AAA discount-- The breakfast that is included has improved fastly-- boiled eggs, waffle iron available, cereal, fruit-- BUT we had asked for a room close to elevator because my Dad is recovering from Broken hip--we were given Totally down the hall. We needed an extra blanket because the room was so cold even after turning off the a/c-- We saw the HBO guide and asked what channel it was-- only to find out there was no HBO except HBOfamily (Clerk said:because of new law in Texas says no adult sexual content available to children--?!???) The electric plug at desk didn't work and the bathroom door was warped and wouldn't close------still sheets were clean and the doorlock worked- so if you only need a bed and continental breakfast for cheap--this is the place

Reviews.Title: “Bugs, Bugs, Bugs!!”
Reviews.Author: moezma2
Reviews.Content: Do not stay at this hotel!! Bugs every where, were told they were crickets. Soon as we got to our room saw dead bugs. Called to ask to get them cleaned up. When the guy came up he cleaned the bugs and changed the light bulb. Asked about heater not working we were told to give it a minute. Waited and waited called front desk again. Was told the heater was not gonna work . Checked out about an hour after checking in. Horrible service would not recommend this hotel to my worst enemy. Dirty run down shocked that it carrys the Best Western name. Web site is a total lie!!

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here.”
Reviews.Author: rlvela
Reviews.Content: This was the worst hotel i have ever stayed in. Its not even worth wasting my time explaining the details. tehy did comp us one night . I should have been smarter and left after teh first bad experience, but I am to forgiving. Just don't stay here.....

Reviews.Title: “DISHONEST, LIVE BUGS, RUN DOWN!!!”
Reviews.Author: lovetofish-10
Reviews.Content: I could not understand anything the front desk clerk said. He gave us a room that had not been cleaned, then moved us to room that the AC was broken. He will look you in the eye and Lie! He said the maintenance man fixed the AC and we spoke to maintenance man and he said he had not done anything yet. That same clerk tried to make us sign a credit receipt that had the wrong total on it after he took our printed conformation # and amount on it. Very dishonest, run down, dirty, live bugs

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel for low price”
Reviews.Author: csqc
Reviews.Content: stayed 2 nights at low internet rate. Could not have done any better for the money we spent. Everything was clean from the pool area to our 2 bed balconey room. Thanks go out to Jan the night manager for helping book the perfect room for us. We had a fairly good view of dallas skyline. Pool area was kind of small but never got crowded. Nice clean hot tub. But no towels offered at pool so bring your own. Coffee maker in room, no frig or microwave. Linens and towels good . Housekeeping did a good job cleaning between our nights of stay. Breakfast was limited but enough to start our day. All was kept stocked and clean in the breakfast area. We travel to the dallas area several times a year and will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY HERE!”
Reviews.Author: mathewhaledavis
Reviews.Content: I had my truck stolen from this hotel in the middle of the afternoon, only about an hour after checking in.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid This Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: VegasChzHed
Reviews.Content: Had eight rooms, 11 people. Everyone had the same opinion of this hotel. Terrible customer service during stay. Dumpy hotel. All rooms dirty and very outdated. Soap and shampoo are in dispensers on the mirror and shower walls...who knows what's in them! Extremely poor customer service after our stay. One room was booked for 4 nights, charged for 6. In process of dispute thru AMEX due to uncooperative hotel management. Management says "someone" was in the room for 6 days. Person checked out and did not extend room so I wonder how "someone" was staying in the room without extending and getting keys updated. Keys are turned off after checkout time. Would stay on a park bench before ever stepping inside this place again!

Reviews.Title: “Tricked”
Reviews.Author: LiketotravelOklahoma
Reviews.Content: Looked on web site to check out this hotel. Virtual view of rooms were misleading. King sized bed rooms very small. Bathroom very, very small. No room to move. Bad musty smell. Took 10-15 minutes to check in and to check out. A breakfast buffet was advertised but was mostly a continental breakfast. I was very disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for the price”
Reviews.Author: jacquee99
Reviews.Content: Very well lit, felt incredibly safe. Front desk seemed aggravated when we contacted them a second time about getting a crib. If they had explained the situation the first time we contacted them we would have understood.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for the price”
Reviews.Author: lilmoonie
Reviews.Content: We paid about $70 for one night and really just needed a place to stay. Only two complaints about the room: there was a funny smell that we didn't really care for (kind of a musty smell) and the coffee pot in the room didn't work. The motel is really close to downtown. We went to the aquarium and the JFK museum, and we got there within 10 mins. No problems with the wireless internet. Not the nicest motel, but if you just need a place to sleep, it gets the job done.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: jerr369
Reviews.Content: The rooms were clean and comfortable. The beds were nice, great pictures and furnture.

Reviews.Title: “Out dated, but a good value”
Reviews.Author: oleiros
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located away from the city centre, but only a few minutes away by car. The hotel is dated and looking a bit old, but it has charm. Breakfast is free and provided in a large dining hall, but there's no restaurant at the hotel. The hotel is affordable and the rooms are large, but they look out-dated... Staff are friendly and helpful

Reviews.Title: “Best service ever”
Reviews.Author: madatmadisonville
Reviews.Content: These guys are great. They really went above and beyond.

Reviews.Title: “Just Creepy”
Reviews.Author: dcjw700
Reviews.Content: Room was small and not very clean. Breakfast was continental at best with lots of carbs and bad coffee. Front desk person was so hard to understand I still am not sure what he was asking so I gave him my license, credit card, and Gold Crown card. Neighborhood on the west side of I-35 is downright scary. Don't stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, Relatively Inexpensive.”
Reviews.Author: sometriptips
Reviews.Content: This property has been somewhat refurbished and seems to have new owners who are anxious to please. The location, on Market Center Blvd., is next to the pricey Hilton Anatole (you can walk over and buy newspapers in the morning -- this hotel had none) The area seems to verge into industrial zoning and there was no walking traffic. Surprisingly convenient -- we had a rental car and we were less than ten minutes from downtown, museums, and good restaurants. There is adequate free internet service and a small work-out room and a pool. Breakfast offerings were limited, but there was juice, fruit, cereal. By carefully selecting a well located room, asking for an additional floor lamp for lighting, and some judicious use of folded paper behind headboards and in the window frame to stop annoying vibrating sounds, we had a quiet, clean room, even if the furniture was a little worn and the room size was small. Would probably stay here again -- it was a very good value.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: wisconsinites2
Reviews.Content: My 19 year old son and I had a wonderful stay here. The hotel offers free shuttle service within 3 miles, which was very convenient, since it was over 100 degrees when we were there. If they were not busy, the driver offered to take us further(to the Back Door Comedy at the Radisson). All the hotel staff were very friendly and helpful. They had a decent hot breakfast and refrigerator and microwave in the room. The rooftop pool was also an asset. We chose not to rent a car, as we were next to the West End Transfer Point. The DART System (bus and train) were easy and convenient. We took a bus to North Park Mall and the Galleria (high end shopping centers). The hotel was also 2 blocks away from Dealey Plaza and the JFK Museum. Many restaurants were near (Spaghetti Factory, Chipotle, Sonny Bryan's, Cadillac Restaurant). I would definitely recommend this place to stay. It's not plush, but the beds were comfortable and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JasmineMarti
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at this hotel. The first time I had stayed in 2002. Now, I was on a business trip to the suburbs of Dalas, but wanted to stay closer to the city so I could dine at the West End, which is a $10 cab ride away. The hotel seemed to have undergone a renovation. It is clean. The location is very easy to arrive at from the airport. Lee at the front desk was very helpful. He let me choose between two rooms, I chose the smaller room with an updated electronic thermostat. The hotel has a little pool, which is very clean and a great oasis for relaxation.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice host”
Reviews.Author: mikearlington1977
Reviews.Content: I have to stay in Dallas for a night. I was impress by the kindness of the host. Hotel is situated minutes from down town, making it perfect for a week end gateway in Dallas. Hotel to consider for any stay in Dallas area.

Reviews.Title: “the best western is the best!”
Reviews.Author: yomanshi
Reviews.Content: great location, great service!

Reviews.Title: “Economy”
Reviews.Author: apfulk
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel because the of economy price and our past experiences at Best Westerns. The price was great, but the room was below what we have experienced at other Best Westerns. There were dead ants in the bathroom and crawling on one of the double beds. This hotel is an open access hotel, none of the rooms are located inside any controlled area. It was kinda scary at night because the area around the hotel is not the best. In fact, we heard automatic gun fire late at night, it was not close by, but kinda of unnerving. The room looked as if it was updated recently, but the update was cheap. On the positive side, the services was FANTASTIC! The hotel staff was \ helpful and wanted to help in any manner they could. The morning continental breakfast was decent. Think cereal, frozen bagels and fruit, but it was free! Not a bad hotel, just don't expect Holiday Inn type economy, this is truly an economy hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not our favorite place”
Reviews.Author: Pahoot
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel based on good reviews we had seen here and because we were looking for something close to Love Field.. We only needed rooms for one night, one for my husband and I and one for my mother-in-law. Frankly, I was very disappointed in our rooms. They seemed to have suffered water damage from the rains early this year. The ceilings in both units had large areas (several square feet) where the plaster had fallen. The carpets were badly waterstained and both rooms had a musty smell. The front desk clerk was not friendly at all. When I called down to ask her to turn off the message light that was blinking on the phone, she didn't even answer the phone so I had to walk down to the office. Breakfast was okay. Mostly bakery items and a little fruit. We paid the same price that we paid for the two rooms at a nearby Residence Inn a week earlier and had a two bedroom suite that was much superior. Guess we learned. We have stayed at really nice Best Westerns but this one is off our list now.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, clean and lovely laidback atmosphere.”
Reviews.Author: natCalifornia
Reviews.Content: Clean, nice service, we stayed at this hotel with an impression that we are in a tropical atmosphere laidback. There gym was available to us also and there internet area very useful. Pretty hotel with pool. We really enjoyed our time and we'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Best Western”
Reviews.Author: tdub58
Reviews.Content: I stay at the Best Western In Dallas Tx. On Market Center Blvd. Quite often. I have found that it is a great place to come to just relax around the pool or in the room. My room is always clean and I injoy staying there. I have recomended the hotel to all my friends.

Reviews.Title: “We will not stay here again!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Best Western Market Center January 21-23, 2006. It was the worst hotel experience I have ever had. We have stayed at this hotel for several years when we go to the Market Center. We love it because it is so close. Plus they have the shuttle you can take to market, this year however they did not have the shuttle service. We have always had wonderful stays and excellent service in the past. But now we found that the staff at this hotel is unfriendly and rude!! On top of dealing with the rude staff we did not sleep. The rooms were extremely hot. It was so uncomfortable. We had the thermostat turned all the way down to cool the room and it was still hot. Getting ready in the mornings we had to open the door because of the heat. We were very unhappy with everything about our stay. Because of this experience we will never stay at a Best Western again!!!

Reviews.Title: “It was OK”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I think i will never get back to the hotel, sometimes the staff is nice, but the woman from the counter screamed at me very mad, the water was gone 2 days... and i didint get any kind of refund, the hotel has a horrible smell, but once you're there you will forget it hahaha, it was really convinient for me, because I went shopping to Galleria and Grape Vine Mills, anyway it was a 2/Star Hotel, and you get what you pay.

Reviews.Title: “The good & bad... an unbiased review”
Reviews.Author: DFWSavyTraveler
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2 nights @ $52/night (special group rate) in Sept. I made a list of the good and bad for you to decide... Good: 1) Price 2) Location was good to where I need to be (Dallas Market Center/World Trade Center just down the road) Far enough off of the Interstate where you don't hear freeway noise. (Behind the Anatole and next to the Wyndham) 3) Nice touches in room (refridgerator, microwave, coffee pot, hair dryer, small sofa, table area) 4) Privately owned and managed 5) Definitely different that your standard motel for decorations (kind of artsy cute & quaint... Spanish Style Theme) 6) Nice (free) breakfast spread each morning off the lobby 7) Carpet appeared new. 8) The largest closet I had ever seen in a hotel room, the room was also a little larger too. Bad: 1) My room had roaches (I counted 5 in 2 days) 2) Musty, humid smell in room (made my allergies go into overdrive) 3) Minor annoyances like loud fan in bathroom came on with the light every time, only compact parking in the front, bathroom very tiny, A/C unit was so loud and couldn't quite get the temp. like I wanted (either too cold or too hot), bed wasn't too comfortable, no internet service available (or at least I couldn't find any anywhere). 4) Some of the rooms in the back were exterior entry... so I wouldn't feel too safe staying there. 5) FYI: They had a no pet policy and a $60/per day fine if they catch you. 6) Rooms are older and some fixtures are dated I can't comment on the pool because I never used or even looked for it. And as for food, I don't know... when I checked in the guy told me they don't have food in the hotel, but there was a room service notation in the brochure. But after seeing my first roach 2 minutes after I got into my room... I wouldn't be ordering it anyway. In my opinion, I wouldn't stay here again because of the roaches (I left the lights on) and allergy issues... I would rather take my chances on priceline for a better place.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonably good”
Reviews.Author: Kanerva
Reviews.Content: Stayed for three nights in Dallas. The service at Best Western Market Center was nice and very helpful. The location could be better. The room was OK and clean, but our "view" was a corridor wall of the hotel. By the looks of it, we had the worst view. Bad luck? There was a safe in the room, but it didn't work and we were told that a repairman was coming in three days. There was a ice-making machine on the grounds, but it did not work. They advertised for a complimentary wireless Internet conection, but it did not work. But they had a room with a computer and additional LAN-plugs comlimentary for guests. That we thought was really nice. The pool and jacuzzi were also very nice. So despite of the things that did not work and the "view" we found the hotel quite O.K. and the price was very reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Going to Market is always a task, we stayed and felt at home. The room was clean and the staff was great....I will stay again Cisse Neal

Reviews.Title: “I loved the Best Western Market Centre”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel provided great value. We were in town on business and the staff went above and beyond to make us feel welcome. The facilities at the hotel were clean and met our needs. We would recommend it to anyone travelling to Dallas. We will definately be back again.

Reviews.Title: “The Greatest Best Western in Texas”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stopped at this Best Western because I was in Dallas for a business trip. Believe or not but I loved so much this hotel that I decided to stay for the week end and visit Dallas. If you do not know where you would stay in Dallas for a trip just stay at his Best Western which is also the best in Texas. A satisfied customer

Reviews.Title: “Best Western Market Center,Dallas”
Reviews.Author: yomanshi
Reviews.Content: The hotel is magnificent and we have never experienced such incredible service before. It's central location makes it perfect for my business trips to the DFW area. I will definitely return on my next visit to Dallas!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value in Dallas”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is a real gem of a hotel. The standout feature is the reasonableness of its room rates but they are almost eclipsed by the friendliness of its staff! On word of caution though, Dallas is a very pedestrian unfriendly city. If you visit donâ€™t plan to walk or use public transport, itâ€™ll ruin you vacation. Instead rent a car or budget for a lot of taxis trips!

Reviews.Title: “The best value in Town!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed the welcome I got from the all team working in this Hotel. People there are really friendly and respectfull, in any case ready to help and give you the best advise upon your request. The Hotel is well maintained, clean, with a glance of fresh atmosphere, given with a Tex Mex decoration.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I had a wonderful stay at this hotel. the staff are really professional and friendly. they help me a lot concerning the places to visit, restaurants...when you don't know a city it's really appreciable. you find everything you need in this hotel pool computer room,a gym room for a great price.

Reviews.Title: “Well done at the BWMC”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: THe staff was fantastic and the facilities were first rate. I highly recommend this well-run establishment.

Reviews.Title: “Sleeping with the Best”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: In recent times I stayed at the Best Western for a seminar I was attending in Dallas. It was in the heart of Dallas- the hotel is small- with a great pool courtyard that makes you forget you are in the middle of a big city, more like on a small beach in Mexico. The staff was helpful. The hotel has everything I needed, the rooms were nice. The restaurant & bar were ok. I had not brought my computer with me, The hotel has 2 computers you can use for free to download email and surf the net. They offer this high speed access for free & this was a great way to keep in touch with news with the family back home (Italy). The Continental breakfast was free, but for the coffee, well lets just say this is not Italy. The staff speak many languages and make reservations for you if necessary. I will stay here again if I come back to Dallas.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Best Western”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at the Best Western. Food was great and staff was pleasant.

HotelInfo.Name: BEST WESTERN Market Center
HotelInfo.Address: 2023 Market Center Boulevard, Dallas, TX 75207
